We found no evidence of a difference in COVID-19 mortality among people who received
hydroxychloroquine for treatment of rheumatological disease before the COVID-19 outbreak
in England. Therefore, completion of randomised trials investigating pre-exposure
pro…
articles.content: Griffith G, Morris TT, Tudball M, et al. Collider bias undermines our understanding of COVID-19 disease risk and severity. Nature Comms (in press).

articles.author: Neil Murphy
articles.title: NHS worker publicly resigns claiming she had 'no work to do for 3 weeks' during pandemic - Mirror Online
articles.description: Shelley Tasker, 43, took to the streets of Truro in Cornwall and told people gathered that she had barely any work to do at the height of the coronavirus pandemic
articles.content:
An NHS worker medic resigned from her job in public in opposition to the coronavirus lockdown - also claiming the pandemic left her with "no work to do for three weeks".
